answers.answer: Assistance includes help-lines, guidance on entry and legal status, accommodation support, currency exchange, banking services, emergency resources, and regional centers for asylum seekers.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Individuals can enter Romania either with the right of short-stay if they have a valid passport, or as an asylum seeker if they lack documents.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Documents'.

answers.answer: Border points available for entry from Ukraine are Halmeu, Sighetu Marmației, Siret, and Isaccea, or individuals can enter via the Republic of Moldova.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Border points you can use to cross into Romania From Ukraine'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian nationals can enter Romania for a short-stay of up to 90 days with a valid passport, or as an asylum seeker if they lack documents. Asylum applications can also be made later within Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Documents'.

answers.answer: All unaccompanied children can cross the border, and the General Directorates for Social Assistance and Child Protection (DGASPC) in each county are authorized to care for them.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Minors entering Romania'.

answers.answer: Individuals can exchange Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH) for Romanian lei (RON) at BCR (Romanian Commercial Bank) up to 2,000 lei per person/Ukrainian passport, at the BNR exchange rate.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Money'.

answers.answer: BCR offers Ukrainian citizens 0 lei costs for POS and ATM transactions with Ukrainian cards, 0 lei commission for opening and administering a current account, and 0 fees for inter and intra bank payments.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Money'.

answers.answer: Temporary accommodation can be secured by accessing 'Un Acoperiș!', which provides support in finding a place to stay.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Accommodation'.

answers.answer: To offer a space to help vulnerable people through 'Un Acoperis', individuals need to access 'Un Acoperiș!'.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Accommodation'.

answers.answer: Regional Centers for Procedures and Accommodation for Asylum Seekers are located in Rădăuți, Satu Mare (Maramureș), Galați, București, Timișoara, and Giurgiu.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Regional Centers for Procedures and Accommodation for Asylum Seekers'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens with a biometric passport do not need a visa to travel to the EU, but it is recommended to contact the embassy of the destination country for specific travel conditions.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Traveling to other Member States of the European Union'.

answers.answer: Someone can obtain emergency resources like food, clothing, or transportation by requesting resources through 'Sprijin de Urgență'.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Emergency help'.

answers.answer: To provide emergency resources or volunteer help, individuals can offer them through 'Sprijin de Urgență' by accessing the "Request or provide resources" option.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Emergency help'.

answers.answer: Contact options for help-lines include CNRR (0040 730 073 170), UNHCR (+40723653651), IOM Romania (021 210 3050), and the National Line against Trafficking in Persons (0 800 800 678 / +4021.313.31.00).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Romania Help-lines'.

answers.answer: Real-time waiting times at border crossings into Romania can be checked on the website https://www.politiadefrontiera.ro/ro/traficonline/.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomohaapp and read the section under 'Border points you can use to cross into Romania From Ukraine'.
